problem: Every 5 months, Hal has to replace the batteries in his calculator. He changed them the first time in May. In what month will they be changed the 25th time?
solution: If the first time was in May, the second time will be 5 months after May, the third time will be $5\cdot2$ months after May, etc. That means the 25th time will be $5\cdot24$ months away. Since the months repeat every 12 months, we look for the remainder when $5\cdot24$ is divided by 12 and add that many months to May. We notice that $\frac{5\cdot24}{12}=5\cdot2$, so it turns out that $5\cdot24$ is a multiple of 12 and leaves a remainder of 0 when divided by 12. So the 25th time will be a certain number of years afterward but still in the same month, $\boxed{\text{May}}$.
socratic_questions:
1. What is the pattern for when Hal has to replace the batteries in his calculator?
2. When did Hal change the batteries in his calculator for the first time?
3. How many months after May will it be when Hal changes the batteries in his calculator for the fifth time?
4. What is the formula for finding the month when Hal will change the batteries for the nth time?
5. How many months will it have been since May when Hal changes the batteries in his calculator for the 25th time?
6. What is the remainder when $5\cdot24$ is divided by 12?
7. What does the remainder from question 6 represent in terms of months?
8. In what month will Hal change the batteries in his calculator for the 25th time?
